isis.stitle: TSI 98-03-02 - Steer Axle Suspension With Threaded Pin/Bushing Wear Limits

subjectgroup.subject: Steer Axle Suspension With Threaded Pin/Bushing Wear Limits

geninfo.para: In the new condition, the clearance between the pin and bushing is .030 inch ( Figure 1). Also, if one end of the pin is rocked from side to side in the bushing bore, the clearance can be up to .050 inch depending on part tolerances ( Figure 1).

Wear Limits: Based on the above measuring parameter, if the pin to bushing clearance exceeds .090 to .100 inch or the end rocking clearance exceeds .150 to .160 inch, the vehicle should be scheduled to have the pin or bushing replaced. If the pin to bushing clearance exceeds .125 inch or the rocking clearance exceeds .210 inch, both the pin and bushing should be replaced.
